thread.title: ‘Good life’ of Wine Country with small-town charm in Forestville
thread.title_full: ‘Good life’ of Wine Country with small-town charm in Forestville - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Katie Hammel
title: ‘Good life’ of Wine Country with small-town charm in Forestville
text:
Photo: Katie Hammel, Special To The Chronicle print_article_embed|photo-8495894|article-6470412|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8495894|article-6470412|1 email_share_embed|photo-8495894|article-6470412|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8495894|article-6470412|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8495894|article-6470412|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8495894|article-6470412|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8495894|article-6470412|5 google_share_embed|photo-8495894|article-6470412|6 Russian River Vineyards is a sprawling complex set among the vines. There's a dog-friendly outdoor tasting area and picnic space, complete with bean bag games. Russian River Vineyards is a sprawling complex set among the vines....
It would be wrong to call Forestville a one-stoplight town. It doesn’t even have that. “Downtown” is just three blocks of Highway 116, which is called Front Street in these parts. But packed into this map dot are enough wineries, farm-to-table restaurants and miles of river to keep you as busy — or not — as you want to be for a long weekend. Russian River Vineyards is a sprawling complex set among the vines. There's a dog-friendly outdoor tasting area and picnic space, complete with bean bag games. Russian River Vineyards is a sprawling complex set among the vines....
It would be wrong to call Forestville a one-stoplight town. It doesn’t even have that. “Downtown” is just three blocks of Highway 116, which is called Front Street in these parts. But packed into this map dot are enough wineries, farm-to-table restaurants and miles of river to keep you as busy — or not — as you want to be for a long weekend.
